text: Viññāṇañca hidaṃ bhikkhave attā abhavissa nayidaṃ viññāṇaṃ ābādhāya saṃvatteyya labbhetha ca viññāṇe evaṃ me viññāṇaṃ hotu evaṃ me viññāṇaṃ mā ahosī ti
edit: Viññāṇañca hidaṃ bhikkhave attā abhavissa nayidaṃ viññāṇaṃ ābādhāya saṃvatteyya labbhetha ca viññāṇe – evaṃ me viññāṇaṃ hotu evaṃ me viññāṇaṃ mā ahosī ti

translations.transtext: If this consiousness, monks, was the self, this consiousness would not exist for illness, and [you] might obtain the consiousness thus, "May my consiousness be in this way, may my consiousness not have been in this way."
